text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 4.15.3, Jeopardy/Termination Assessments, Assessment Procedures (Centralized Case Processing).
Material changes to the IRM are listed in the table below:

(2) Material changes to the IRM are listed in the table below: IRM Reference Description of Change IRM 4.15.3.1.5 Added acronyms for Automated Manual Assessment (AMA), Automated Non- Master File (ANMF), Business Master File (BMF), Centralized Case Processing (CCP), Central Standard Time (CST), Enterprise e-Fax system (EEFax), Kansas City Submission Processing Center (KCSPC), Revenue Ac- counting Control System (RACS), Social Security Number (SSN) and Taxpayer Delinquent Account (TDA). IRM 4.15.3.1.6 Added Automated Non-Master File (ANMF) and Enterprise e-Fax system (EEFAX) to the Terms Table. IRM 4.15.3.1.7 Added additional references to the Related Resources Table. IRM 4.15.3.2 • Updated IRM reference from IRM 4.15.2.4.1.4.1 to IRM 4.15.1.7.5 because IRM 4.15.2 will be obsoleted and consolidated with IRM 4.15.1. • Changed timeframe for assessment to be made from 24 hours to 48 hours from Area Director approval. Because of time zone issues, this change was made to facilitate any minor delay. • Added note that Non-Master File (NMF) assessments are handled by KCSPC and that NMF assessments post to ANMF system. IRM 4.15.3.2.1 Added comment that quick assessments for NMF are transmitted to KCSPC rather than Ogden Campus Accounting. IRM 4.15.3.2.2(1) Added note that NMF assessments are handled by KCSPC and CCP will forward Forms 2859/2644 to KCSPC. IRM 4.15.3.3 • Updated Campus for Termination NMF assessments to KCSPC and added references to KCSPC throughout subsection. • Added titles for Forms 2644 and 2859. IRM 4.15.3.3(3) Added comment that KCSPC will issue Form 6335 for NMF assessments. IRM 4.15.3.4 Added KCSPC throughout subsection, as they process NMF assessments now. (3) Editorial changes were made to this IRM to edit grammar and update references.
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
AUDIENCE
Appeals, Large Business and International (LB&I), Small Business/Self-Employed (SB/SE), Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TE/GE) and Wage and Investment (W&I) employees.
Assessment Procedures (Centralized Case Processing)

Program Scope and Objectives
Assessment Procedures (Centralized Case Processing) 4.15.3 page 1
Scope and (

) Audience . These procedures apply to Appeals, Large Business and Interna- tional (LB&I), Small Business/Self-Employed (SB/SE), Tax Exempt Government Entities (TE/GE) and Wage and Investment (W&I), employees. (
) Policy Owner . The Director, Examination - Field and Campus Policy, which under the Director, Headquarters Examination. (
) IRM Owner . Field Examination Special Processes (FESP), which is under Director, Examination - Field and Campus Policy. (
) Primary Stakeholders . Stakeholders include Small Business/Self-Employed (SB/SE) and Wage and Investment (W&I) employees. (
) Contact Information . To recommend changes or make any other suggestions related to this IRM section, see IRM
, Providing Feedback About an IRM Section - Outside of Clearance. (
) Program Goals . The goal of this section is to provide procedures for the ration, assessment, and conﬁrmation of jeopardy/termination assessments. (
) This IRM section provides examiners with information and guidance on the preparation, assessment process and conﬁrmation of the Jeopardy/Termination Assessment. (
) The IRS has the authority under IRC

, Examination of Books and Witnesses, to examine any books, papers, records or other data for the purpose of ascertaining the correctness of any return or making a return none has been made. If the IRS believes the collection of a deﬁciency will jeopardized by delay, it may make a jeopardy assessment of such deﬁciency, or if the tax year has not ended or the return ﬁling date has not passed, a mination assessment of income tax, without regard to any notice of the proposed assessment usually required, under the following IRC sections: • IRC
, Termination Assessments of Income Tax. • IRC
, Termination Assessments in Case of Flagrant Political ditures of Section
) Organizations. • IRC
, Jeopardy Assessments of Income, Estate, Gift, and Certain Excise Taxes. • IRC
, Jeopardy Assessment of Taxes Other Than Income, Estate, Gift, and Certain Excise Taxes. • IRC
, Presumptions Where Owner of Large Amount of Cash is Identiﬁed.
Program Goals . The goal of this section is to provide procedures for the prepa- ration, assessment, and conﬁrmation of jeopardy/termination assessments.
) The IRS has the authority under IRC

, Examination of Books and Witnesses, to examine any books, papers, records or other data for the purpose of ascertaining the correctness of any return or making a return where none has been made. If the IRS believes the collection of a deﬁciency will be jeopardized by delay, it may make a jeopardy assessment of such deﬁciency, or if the tax year has not ended or the return ﬁling date has not passed, a ter- mination assessment of income tax, without regard to any notice of the proposed assessment usually required, under the following IRC sections:
• IRC
, Termination Assessments of Income Tax. • IRC
, Termination Assessments in Case of Flagrant Political Expen- ditures of Section
) Organizations. • IRC
, Jeopardy Assessments of Income, Estate, Gift, and Certain Excise Taxes. • IRC
, Jeopardy Assessment of Taxes Other Than Income, Estate, Gift, and Certain Excise Taxes. • IRC
, Presumptions Where Owner of Large Amount of Cash is Not Identiﬁed.
Note: A jeopardy assessment or a termination assessment of income tax is to be used sparingly; see IRM
, Policy Statement
, Jeopardy As- sessments to be Used Sparingly and Assessment to be Reasonable in Amount, and IRM
, Policy Statement
, Termination Assess- ments of Income Tax to be Used Sparingly and Assessments to be Reasonable in Amount, respectively.
4.15 Jeopardy/Termination Assessments

Acronym Deﬁnition AMA Automated Manual Assessment ANMF Automated Non-Master File BMF Business Master File CCP Centralized Case Processing CST Central Standard Time EEFax Enterprise e-Fax system FESP Field Exam Special Processes KCSPC Kansas City Submission Processing Center MF Master File MFT Master File Tax NMF Non-Master File RACS Revenue Accounting Control System SSN Social Security Number TDA Taxpayer Delinquent Account TIN Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number
The following table lists commonly used terms and associated deﬁnitions:
Assessment Procedures (Centralized Case Processing) 4.15.3 page

Term Deﬁnition Automated Non-Master File System (ANMF) A stand-alone system for maintaining accounts that cannot be processed on Master File. Enterprise e-Fax system (EEFax) A tool that enables IRS employees to receive and send electronic fax documents directly from their workstations. Possessor of Cash Assessment If an individual, in physical possession of cash or its equivalent in excess of $10,000, does not claim the cash as theirs or as belonging to another person who can be easily identiﬁed and who ac- knowledges ownership of the cash, then for purposes of IRC 6851 and IRC 6861, it is presumed that: a. The cash represents gross income of a single individual for the taxable year in which the possession occurs; and b. The collection of tax is presumed to be jeop- ardized by delay. See IRM 5.17.15.3, Presumption Regarding $10,000 in Unclaimed Cash. 4.15.3.1.7(10-05-2021) Related Resources (1) The following table contains related resources referenced in this IRM: Resources Title IRM 1.2.1.5.27 Policy Statement 4-88, Jeopardy Assessments to be Used Sparingly and Assessment to be Reasonable in Amount IRM 1.2.1.5.28 Policy Statement 4-89, Termination Assessments to be Used Sparingly and Assessment to be Reasonable in Amount IRM 3.17.46.6.12 Termination Assessments IRM 3.17.244.3 Quick, Prompt, Jeopardy and Termination Master File Assessments IRM 4.10.8.4.1 Individual and Corporate Cases IRM 4.10.8.17.1 Completion of Form 5344, Examination Closing Record

4.15 Jeopardy/Termination Assessments
Assessments (
) The Chief Counsel (or the Chief Counsel’s delegate) must approve a jeopardy/ termination assessment. IRC
)(A), Review of Jeopardy Levy or Assessment Procedures. Counsel should sign off last on the jeopardy/ termination assessment before it is submitted to the Area Director for approval. See IRM
, Securing Approval of the Report. The office that receives the approved report signed by the Area Director must make the assessment within

hours. Jeopardy/termination assessments will be prepared following quick assessment procedures. Quick assessments are made on either Master File (MF) or Non-Master File (NMF). Note: NMF are generally processed in the same manner as MF, except the numbering is different and abstract codes are needed for individual MF and Business Master File (BMF) adjustments. NMF assessments are handled by Kansas City Submission Processing Center (KCSPC) rather than Ogden Campus Accounting. NMF assessments post to the Automated Non-Master File (ANMF) system which is a stand-alone system for maintaining accounts that cannot be processed on MF. (
) Requests for quick assessments will be made by telephone or electronic facsimile using the Enterprise e-Fax system (EEFax). EEFax is the preferred method to request a quick assessment. Form
, Recommendation for Jeopardy/Termination Assessment, will be used to request quick assessments, in addition to Form
, Request for Quick or Prompt Assessment.

Note: NMF are generally processed in the same manner as MF, except the numbering is different and abstract codes are needed for individual MF and Business Master File (BMF) adjustments. NMF assessments are handled by Kansas City Submission Processing Center (KCSPC) rather than Ogden Campus Accounting. NMF assessments post to the Automated Non-Master File (ANMF) system which is a stand-alone system for maintaining accounts that cannot be processed on MF. (
) Requests for quick assessments will be made by telephone or electronic facsimile using the Enterprise e-Fax system (EEFax). EEFax is the preferred method to request a quick assessment. Form
, Recommendation for Jeopardy/Termination Assessment, will be used to request quick assessments, in addition to Form
, Request for Quick or Prompt Assessment.
and Form
, Document Transmittal Form, for each type of tax return. Include the name control, MFT, TIN, tax period, and Control number. In the remarks area, enter the
C date and “FAX QUICK ASSESSMENT”. Address the form to the appro- priate function and include the originator’s complete address, mail stop and fax number so the receipted Form
, Document Transmittal Form, maybe faxed back.
Assessment Procedures (Centralized Case Processing) 4.15.3 page

Note: If two work days or less remain before the statute of limitations will expire, follow telephonic quick assessment procedures. See IRC 6871, Claims for Income, Estate, Gift and Certain Excise Taxes in Receivership Proceedings.
The assessment is made according to the type of assessment:

Note: CCP can still process the jeopardy assessment and should then forward the package to the RACS Unit in KCSPC If a tax year is not on MF. RACS will input the assessment on the Automated Manual Assessment (AMA). The signed Form
C, Assessment Certiﬁcate - Summary Record of Assessments, secures the as- sessment. The assessment will not appear right away but it will be a legal assessment as long as there is a signed Form
C certiﬁcate. The assessment will post once the account is estab- lished on MF.

Termination- Assessment is made on NMF as a short period, even though the period may be a full period. The assessment is made as a short period to differentiate between the termination period and the full period under normal ﬁling requirements. NMF assessments are done by KCSPC. CCP will prepare and send Form 2859, Request for Quick or Prompt Assessment and Form 2644, Recommendation for Jeopardy/ Termination Assessment to the RACS Unit in KCSPC. The RACS Unit will generalize the transactions and then route them to the NMF group

temporary TIN is created for possessor of cash assessments. a. New Taxable Entity — A new taxable entity (dummy ﬁle) is created for the individual who is in physical possession of the cash. All documents requiring entity information must use “(Possessor’s Name) as Possessor of Certain Cash” as the name line. b. Temporary TIN — A temporary TIN must be obtained for all assessments made under IRC

, Presumptions Where Owner of Large Amount of Cash is not Identiﬁed, regardless of information indicating the possess- or’s personal TIN. Contact the campus entity function to obtain a temporary TIN. The use of the temporary TIN will enable separate tax liability treatment for the possessed cash and avoid any effect on the possessor’s personal individual tax liability, which remains separate from the IRC
assessment.
CCP must forward the following items to Ogden Campus Accounting (jeopardy assessments) and/or KCSPC (termination assessments):
• Copy of Form
, Recommendation for Jeopardy/Termination Assess- ment; • Copy of Form
, Request for Quick or Prompt Assessment; • Copy of Form
, Examination Closing Record, prepared in accor- dance with IRM
, Completion of Form
, Examination Closing Record; • Copy of Form
, Special Handling Notice for Examination Case cessing, prepared in accordance with IRM
, Workpaper System and Case File Assembly; • Copy of Pages
and
of applicable Form
, Report of Income Tax Examination Changes, portion of the tax computation prepared in accor- dance with IRM
, Individual and Corporate Cases; and • Copy of narrative. Note: All forms in this section can be faxed to the respective recipients through EEFax. Ogden EEFax number for Jeopardy Assessments is
Kansas EEFax number for Termination Assessments is

) After the jeopardy/termination assessment information is transmitted to Ogden Campus Accounting (jeopardy assessments) or KCSPC Campus Accounting (termination assessments), respectively, will process the assessment and provide CCP with the required information showing that an assessment was made. (
) For MF, Ogden Campus Accounting will process the jeopardy assessment forward Form
, Prompt Assessment Billing Assembly, to CCP. For NMF, KCSPC will generate Form
, NMF First Notice, and forward to CCP. NMF assessments will post immediately to Taxpayer Delinquent Account (TDA) and be posted to IDRS with a “N” after the taxpayer’s SSN. See IRM
, Termination Assessments, for further information. (
) CCP Action — After the assessment is made by Ogden Campus Accounting (Jeopardy Assessments) and/or KCSPC (Termination Assessments), CCP will return one copy of Form
to the examiner. Assessment (
) After the jeopardy/termination assessment is processed by CCP, Ogden Campus Accounting will provide Form

, Prompt Assessment Billing Assembly, to CCP for Master File assessments. The form will be reviewed by CCP to verify the name, address, TIN, tax period and assessment information are consistent with Form
, Request for Quick or Prompt Assessment. KCSPC will provide Form
, NMF First Notice, for Non-Master File assess- ments. (
) After processing, Form
(MF) or Form
(NMF) and Form
are faxed to the Area Office through EEFax. Form
(MF) or Form
(NMF) must be associated with the control copy in CCP. (
) Upon request, the campus will withhold manual and/or computer billing. (
) Veriﬁcation Errors — Immediately contact Ogden Campus Accounting and/or KCSPC for issuance of a corrected bill if any errors are detected on Form
(MF) or Form
(NMF). If veriﬁcation of the assessment is not received, the CCP Manager, or designated employee must follow-up with Ogden Campus Accounting and/or KCSPC.
